Reviews.Title: “Basic, but good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Bahadir
Reviews.Content: If you only need to stay briefly in Barcelona, and if you are after something basic, this may be a good value for money. But expect nothing special. The reception service is slow, but helpful. Even simple things seem to take much longer than you might expect, but to be fair, they eventually resolve problems. I was given a non-smoking room which was stinking of cigarette smoke, so they changed my room to a better one. The hotel charge included free wifi and breakfast. Wifi worked quite well. Breakfast was very basic, and it did not start on time. It was supposed to start at 07:00 (which is quite late, but perhaps normal in Spain). It was still not serving at 07:15, so I had to leave as I could miss my flight. The room was I stayed was quite nice, and seemed clean (but I have seen some bugs in the bathroom). Perhaps one of the most annoying thing is that they did not have iron or iron boards, and the laundry service is not always available, if you need to leave the hotel for a meeting you can be caught by surprise. Overall, it was not a bad hotel stay, but expect really basis services, if you need more, pay a bit more and go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad. Clean but cramped”
Reviews.Author: kju56
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and the staff friendly and helpful. The single room was really quite small compared to other hotels I have stayed in within this price bracket. Unfortunately, the walls were paper thin and you can hear conversations in other rooms very clearly. The movement of a chair in the room above sounded like thunder! I dont like to mark this down because you certainly felt welcome at the hotel and the environment feels pretty secure too. However, I think it is a three star stop.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean and nice otel”
Reviews.Author: serkan C
Reviews.Content: Not far from the city center. 5-10 min walk to Metro. Hotel rooms cleaned every day. We had a double room. Our room was broad and bright. Rooms looking to street but there is no noice because double windows. There was a large and clean bathroom with double sink. Large LCD available in the room. But unfortunately all channels are in spanish. Minibar and safe are available. Safe box is not electronic and to use it, have to pay an extra fee. Throughout the hotel, there is free wireless internet, but it is not very good at the room, constantly interrupted. Breakfast 6 €, not very rich, but enough.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant & very helpfull staff; value for money”
Reviews.Author: GZVD
Reviews.Content: For this price you won't get much better. Exactly what you (..) would want in basics for a hotel: Clean everywhere, good bed in small but more than enough room (I think a hotel is mostly meant for sleeping, For the rest you want to work or visit the city you're in). 24 hrs Good entrance, I had my own computer which worked fine. If you want more than a very simple breakfast there are enough possibilities outside. Staff speaks english/spanish and some even other languages; Plus able to arrange car rental reservation, relaxed in/out checking. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: fran_beca
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at the Hotel Medium in Barcelona, Spain. It is clean, friendly, accomadating and quiet. It is well situated for the train station. There are resturants and shopping near as well as many coffee and fresh bread shops. The beds are clean, comfortable and the bathroom is well accomodated. A lovely bath was had by my friend. We had travelled all night on the train from Burgos and the clerk was kind enough, even though we came without a reservation and at about 8:00am., to clean a room for us and not charge us extra. We bathed, had quiet restful sleep and were refreshed for dinner and the city bus tour which was near the train station in a double decker bus. That evening we enjoyed restful sleep so we were refreshed for our flight the next morning to the USA. The hotel clerk arranged for an English speaking taxi also who was so informative about all the different airports in Barcelona and realistically we would have most likely gone to the incorrect one if we had taken the bus ourselves. It was also nice to have a view of the town from the cab. This is the hotel we will stay at if ever in Barcelona again. We prefer it. It also has internet access and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed every moment.”
Reviews.Author: AGvanderWesthuizen
Reviews.Content: When we arrived it was on a bank holiday. Were so disappointed - all the shops was closed and there was hardly people on the streets. I was accused of booking a "cheap" hotel outside the CBD. Well the next morning the whole situation changed, shops, restaurants, etc., were open and the area came to life. Hotel Medium Prisma is a great find. Close to the Barcelona Sant train station, information office, tourist bus and Diagonal high street for shopping. The local busses stop in front of the Hotel. TIP: Get yourself a T-10 bus ticket and a map, you have NO transport problems. If I have to complain: The shower pressure on the 4th floor could be better. Staff are very friendly and they try to speak English. A good laundry, bakery & fruiter next to the hotel. Rooms are smallish, but quiet, air-conditioned and lovely dark to sleep well. Good Wi-fi signal.

Reviews.Title: “The little hotel that tries.”
Reviews.Author: RobertJackson78
Reviews.Content: Smallest room I've ever seen. Pros - Very clean. - Staff tries hard. Cons - Very internet however very spotty at best. - Very bad location, expect to travel. - Not that much variety in food in location, many restaurants, all the same options. - Rooms are very, very small. They don’t get smaller than this.

Reviews.Title: “Inconveniently Located Hotel. Most staff knew very little English”
Reviews.Author: WKM1914
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rather inconveniently located. Everything around the hotel appears to be closed all day everyday and the staff for the most part isn't too knowledgeable about the city or the English language (which is fine as it is Spain). There was one day staff person that was helpful, however. The rooms are very small and you cannot open the door completely. When you ask the housekeeping staff not to clean the room, they tend to do it anyway. They simply ignore the do not disturb sign on the door. I would not recommend this hotel as there are hotels more conveniently located for the same price and more ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Not for light sleepers but nice and cheap”
Reviews.Author: maltinpolar
Reviews.Content: The staff is kind, the location is good, the rooms are fine and even the breakfast is good. Noise is the only problem in this hotel. Our room was on the first floor and we could hear the morning chats at the entrance from our bed. I must say that this is a general problem in European cities, where many hotels are placed in buildings that were not built up as such. Compared to the smelly hostels that, by the way, are not much cheaper than this one, this place is heaven. Single glass windows are common in Spain so this place is no exception. I will definitely come back here instead of the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for solo travelers”
Reviews.Author: patrickchabot
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel was okay. A bit far from downtown, but perfect if you like to walk and enjoy the city. From the airport, you take the train and get off 3rd station (Barcelona Sants), and walk up there. Very easy to get there. The room was a bit small, but was clean. The receptionist was helpful, spoke a very good english. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Paper-Thin Walls Trump Basically Everything”
Reviews.Author: SFGuy35
Reviews.Content: While traveling in Europe, I had a change in plans and headed to Barcelona for a few days, making plans at the last minute. Many hotels were already booked but the Medium Prisma showed rates of 49E/night for a single, and booking on their web site got free wifi thrown into the deal. The hotel is clean and even makes a half-hearted attempt at style in the lobby, but two factors trump everything: the noise and the location. The walls and door to my tiny little room were so thin that every small noise seemed to be right in the room. The hotel has (admittedly, spotlessly clean) tile or slate floors, but this served to amplify sound even further. Breakfast dishes clinking one floor down sounded like they were above my head, maids moving furniture in the room next door might as well have been running jackhammers directly into my brain. At one point in the evening I was awakened by what sounded like someone crumpling paper in the hallway. It's that bad. Location is terrible even for the intrepid. Subway stops are a good 15 minute walk away, and those on a line that goes parallel to the center, requiring an awkward changeover. I'm an avid public transit user and went online to figure out the bus system, but even that was a nightmare, with only one bus meandering towards the center of town from the hotel's street. There are a few restaurants nearby as well as what appear to be, er, gentlemen's clubs, but after about 10pm nothing is open within what seems to be a mile-wide radius. Taxis are not cheap in Barcelona and you'll spend about 5E to get to the center -- plus if you can figure out the night bus ("nitbus") routes, those aren't included, inexplicably, on your all-inclusive transit card. Go figure. It was the "high season" for tourists in Barcelona, sure, and a non-skeezy, clean bed for under 50 euros a night is a damn good bargain, I'll admit. But if you can't sleep through the night because the walls are made of some sort of sound-amplifying cardboard, what's the point? And if you're going to spend 10E/day on cabs to get anywhere, you better figure that into your budget.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy small hotel but spotlessly clean”
Reviews.Author: DublinTara
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 2km from the Barcelona Sants Station. Take the no. 32 bus from the station for about €1.35! The hotel in on one one of the main streets to the Bus Station and city centre so the street is quite noisy, also it is beside a bank and work traffic begins around 7.30am. The hotel windows are not double glazed and the walls are quite thin - I even heard the persons in the next room to us having a shower and their singing! Besides the noise and the quite small double room - it does have everything you would need and was very very clean. Breakfast is not included and costs about €6 per person and is all a typical continental breakfast but is an "all you can eat". My tip - ask for a room at the back of the hotel and not adjacent to either the main or side street.

Reviews.Title: “Not as close to Sants station as we thought”
Reviews.Author: Bel_Ludovic
Reviews.Content: The only - and I repeat *only* - reason we booked this hotel was because we were led to believe it was very close to Barcelona Sants station, from where we needed to catch a train early the next morning. After trekking for quite a while down Josep Tarradelles avenue, we discovered that this wasn't the case. The hotel was a good 10 minutes walk away - which is too long a walk when you've got heavy luggage. Arriving disgruntled, we were made to wait another 30 minutes because our room wasn't ready yet - this despite the fact we arrived at 13:30. These annoyances aside, the hotel was quite nice. The decor wasn't 'state-of-the-art', as the brochure proclaimed, but modern and comfortable, with a particularly appealing bathroom. Add a minibar, air-con, and free internet access from the lobby and the hotel seemed reasonable value. Breakfast was extra, though - and was OK, though nothing remarkable given it cost €8.60. Skip it and fill up at the patisserie next door instead. All in all, I wouldn't stay here again, mainly because the area is rather nondescript, quite far from the city centre and not really near anything else of interest to make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mamaleens
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and it was a fantastic stay. The receptionist (French)was so friendly and helpful. The price was so good for such a fantastic room and breakfast. Highly recommendable. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but loud”
Reviews.Author: livingineurope
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel between Christmas and New Year on a short getaway. The room was clean, but a little short on space (the floor plan showed the room with only one bed, but there were two single beds pushed together - this might explain the lack of space). Also, the lamps on the bedside tables covered nearly the entire surface, making it hard to put an alarm clock or glasses there (everything was rather precariously balanced). The closet door didn't open far enough to see into the closet, but things could be pushed in and pulled out. The above are all just inconveniences that I could have lived with, but the noise level in the hotel was extreme. I heard the conversations my neighbors had, people walking in the hall, people walking down the street - even with the windows closed. I got next to no sleep during the week I was there (a combination of the noise and not being used to sleeping alone, probably). The location was convenient, the staff was nice, and there was a computer available for going on-line, but I won't be back unless I am planning on staying awake for my entire visit.
